skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: Collaborative design exploration that refines ideas into validated specs through iterative questioning. Use before any creative work including creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior.
skill.summary: Collaborative design exploration that refines ideas into validated specs through iterative questioni...
skill.author: CodingCossack

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill describing a collaborative design methodology. Contains only prompts and instructions for AI assistants. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access. All 59 static findings are false positives triggered by documentation terms and metadata hashes.

content.value_statement: Turning vague ideas into clear specifications is difficult without structure. This skill guides you through collaborative questioning to explore alternatives, evaluate trade-offs, and produce validated design documents ready for implementation.
actual_capabilities: Guide iterative idea refinement through single focused questions
Propose multiple design approaches with trade-off analysis
Structure design presentations in 200-300 word sections
Validate design sections incrementally with user feedback
Generate architecture, component, and data flow documentation
Write validated designs to docs/plans/ directory
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests on design proposals
Does not access external APIs or services for validation
Requires user participation for decision-making at each stage
Does not generate implementation code directly

use_cases.title: Feature Design Sessions
use_cases.description: Collaborate on new feature designs before writing code, exploring trade-offs and validating architecture early.

use_cases.title: Requirements Clarification
use_cases.description: Refine vague product ideas into clear specifications through structured questioning and iterative refinement.

use_cases.title: Architecture Planning
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive technical designs covering components, data flow, error handling, and testing strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Start Feature Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a [feature type] for my project. First, let me show you the current project context.

prompt_templates.title: Explore Alternatives
prompt_templates.prompt: What are 2-3 different approaches we could take for [component]? Include trade-offs and your recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Review Design Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Here's the architecture section of our design. Does this approach work for what we discussed? [paste section]

prompt_templates.title: Finalize Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: We've validated all sections. Write the complete design document to docs/plans/ and commit it to git.

output_examples.input: Help me design a user authentication system for our React app
output: Approach 1: JWT tokens with HTTP-only cookies - simpler backend, slightly more complex frontend
Approach 2: Session-based auth with server-side storage - better security visibility, requires session management
Approach 3: OAuth 2.0 with third-party providers - fastest to implement, less control over user data
My recommendation: JWT with HTTP-only cookies for most cases. It scales well and integrates cleanly with React.

output_examples.input: I need to design a data pipeline for processing customer orders
output: Let me understand your current system first. What data sources do you have and what format is the customer data in currently?
Do you have real-time processing requirements or can this run as batch jobs?

best_practices: Start by exploring the existing project context before asking design questions
Ask one question per message to avoid overwhelming the user
Use multiple-choice questions when possible to speed up decision-making
Validate each design section incrementally before moving forward
anti_patterns: Asking multiple questions in a single response
Skipping trade-off analysis and jumping to one solution
Presenting large design blocks without incremental validation
Ignoring YAGNI (You Aren't Gonna Need It) principles

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires conversational interaction for iterative questioning.

faq.question: How detailed are the generated designs?
faq.answer: Designs cover architecture, components, data flow, error handling, and testing. Each section is 200-300 words for easy review.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, it references using-git-worktrees and writing-plans skills for implementation setup after design completion.

faq.question: Is user data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. It only reads context you provide and generates text output.

faq.question: Why does it ask one question at a time?
faq.answer: Single questions prevent overwhelm and allow focused answers. Multiple choice questions speed up decision-making when options are clear.

faq.question: How is this different from general chat?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured methodology with specific phases: understanding, exploring approaches, and incremental validation.
